column1: neurodelightful 160870356576 "2017-05-20 11:49:45 GMT" https://neurodelightful.tumblr.com/post/160870356576/faq "Will you tag __? Yes! If you want me to tag something please let me know! Can I follow/reblog if I‚Äôm neurotypical/allistic? Yes
column2: but please check my #before you follow. What is a spoonie? Can‚Äôt explain it better than the original: The Spoon TheoryWhat is your opinion on __? I‚Äôm sorry but I won‚Äôt answer these types of questions
column3: that‚Äôs not what this blog is for and most of these questions are discourse.Can I suggest changes to your products? Yes! I greatly appreciate feedback! Feel free to contact me if you have an idea to improve my items." True text

column1: neurodelightful 160870352366 "2017-05-20 11:49:31 GMT" https://neurodelightful.tumblr.com/post/160870352366/before-you-follow "Neurodelightful aims to be a safe and positive place for all  neurodivergent people. We are inclusive to all genders and orientations.  We are a discourse free blog. We are disability and neurodivergent  advocates
column2: so we will post relevant things from time to time (these will  be tagged as #advocacy or #political)Kink
column3: porn
column4: and nsfw blogs are not allowed to follow or interact
column5: and will be blocked. Do not follow if you are  ableist
column13: xenophobic or (trans-)misogynist. If you are unsure
column14: please ask before following!" True text

column1: neurodelightful 160870246566 "2017-05-20 11:43:33 GMT" https://neurodelightful.tumblr.com/post/160870246566/about "Neurodelightful is a shop I started to help increase access to stimming tools to those who need them
column2: as well as to be a way I can help support my family. I am a 27 year old woman who is disabled and has autism
column3: ADHD
column4: and anxiety
column5: as well as bouts of depression. My husband is also autistic
column8: as well as physical disabilities. He helps me test the products for my shop as well as think of new items and sometimes helps create them.I am currently mostly working from stuff from my craft hoard
column9: as I am starting from nothing. For now all the profit from my shop is used to expand the inventory. Once I have more financial freedom
column10: I want to have a better focus on providing discrete stim tools to help those that may not be able to stim freely in their environment for whatever reasons. If this sounds like you
column11: and you‚Äôre looking for a certain type of stim item
column12: let me know and I can try to find something that works with you!" True text

column1: neurodelightful 160656351175 "2017-05-14 13:30:42 GMT" https://neurodelightful.tumblr.com/post/160656351175/updated-blogs-i-recommend-following-in-relation-to "charcoalranger: For @darkest-galaxy awhile back I made you a list of good blogs to follow but I thought I should update it as 1 went inactive and Ive found more so here you go. @autisticliving @autisticadvocacy @autisticwomen @askanautistic @autism-asks @proudautisticliving @autistic-batboy @autisticheadcanons @autistic-characters-of-the-day  @autisticfaerie @deanslittlebabypunk @aut-of-space @positivelyautistic @stimmystuffs @stimtastic @stimmingsensation @fuckyeahvalidation  @elzear-stims @hyper-verbal @autisticcharactersofthedayposts @fabulousfidgets @lgbtautistics   @neurodeervergent @neurodelightful @positivityautistic @myautisticjournal @overexplainingautistic @scriptautistic  @adaemonie @sensory-heaven @spacedstim @stimmystims @stimmystimboy @stimmyperidot @autpunkrevived @sunshinestimming @swirlymind @sweetandsavageautistic @yellows-stim-toy-hoarde @thatautismfeel @thenerdyautistic hope this helps and I‚Äôll add more when there is more.  Sorry for being way way late
column2: but thank you very much for including me in this list
column3: I‚Äôm deeply honored!" False text

column1: neurodelightful 160421690641 "2017-05-07 23:06:36 GMT" https://neurodelightful.tumblr.com/post/160421690641/question-for-my-followers "fidgeteen: I want to order some new fidgets from aliexpress. Has anyone had any successful (or unsuccessful) purchases from this website? They‚Äôre basically the same as Wish. It will be a different seller for every item so be sure to check reviews on everything. I‚Äôve bought a fidget cube
column2: spinners
column3: and other stimmy things from them with no problem. Shipping can be pretty slow because it‚Äôs all from overseas
column4: but I‚Äôve yet to have an item go missing. If it does go missing or comes in broken they‚Äôll refund your money. I‚Äôd recommend them
column5: my only issue is their tracking is abysmal
column6: so don‚Äôt rely on it." False text

column1: neurodelightful 160334169062 "2017-05-05 13:30:48 GMT" https://neurodelightful.tumblr.com/post/160334169062/where-to-buy-fidgetstim-toys-irl "stimmystimmycocoapuff: fidgeteen: Fidget toys are great- I couldn‚Äôt function without them! Some of the best ones can only be found online
column2: but sometimes it‚Äôs more convenient (for whatever reason) to buy them in person. With some creativity and a good eye you can find great stim toys almost anywhere. That having been said
column3: here are some of my favorite places to shop for them: Target: There is always something to fidget with at Target. Check the dollar spot
column4: the party favor section
column5: and the party favor/generic cheap things area of the toy section. Sometimes puzzles and games can be repurposed for stimming as well. I‚Äôve also heard that the baby section has chewable items.Stop&Shop: The toy section has playdoh and squishy things! Silicone pot holders are also great stim toys.Claire‚Äôs: Depends on the day because their stock rotates quickly
column6: but they can have stretchy wristbands (coiled or otherwise)
column8: and other stuff. Specialty Toy Stores: A lot of these places will have stuff like Thinking Putty
column12: and fancy games/puzzles that have parts that can be taken to fidget with. Oftentimes blind bag items (such as Mashems/Fashems) can be used for fidgeting while bearing the likeness of your favorite character! ¬†Specialty Bookstores: Depends on the store
column13: but book stores that have toy sections often carry fidget items or puzzles/games that can be used as such. Any store with a Toysmith Kiosk: This category often falls under the above two. As a kid
column14: all my fidgets came from toysmith displays. Nowadays you can even get Tangle Juniors in some of them. There is something for every fidgeter at one of these. Drugstores: This one can be a hit-or-miss
column15: but I‚Äôve seen stress balls and squishy seasonal items at CVS and independent drugstores.Tourist trap souvenir/junk shops:These places often carry stress balls
column18: or practical joke items that can be repurposed for your needs. Museum Shops: You can find Tangles
column21: and other handmade or local fidget toys here. Science museums often carry physics toys
column23: or squishy dinosaurs/the like. Pro tip: you can enter most museum shops without buying a ticket to the museum. Happy Stimming/Fidgeting! Some more places you can find stim/fidgets in store is..MeijerWalmartDollar storesMall toy storesMichaels Craft StoreFive Below" False text

column1: neurodelightful 160299323679 "2017-05-04 13:30:38 GMT" https://neurodelightful.tumblr.com/post/160299323679/elzear-stims-omg-so-i-just-downloaded-the-app "elzear-stims: Omg so I just downloaded the app Talk for Me (warning I have an iPhone it might not be on other app stores) and it‚Äôs really helpful! You can set custom phrases and there are a few different voice options. And the best part
column2: it‚Äôs freeüå± This sounds great for semi/nonverbal folks! Also good for when your voice is out from being sick (in my experience)" False text

column1: neurodelightful 160151824515 "2017-04-30 13:30:37 GMT" https://neurodelightful.tumblr.com/post/160151824515/redinstead-april-challenge-day-30-i-am-autism "This is another one of those topics that I feel like I could do something really good with
column2: but as I am lately I‚Äôm just not going to do it the justice that I could.Because I AM Autism. My executive dysfunction keeps me from being able to start this the way I need to. My alexithymia keeps me from being able to string the words I want together to properly express myself the way I want. My sensory processing disorder keeps pulling away my focus so that what words I could put together get jumbled or forgotten. I have my days here and there where I‚Äôm clear-headed and focused
column3: where I have the ‚Äòspoons‚Äô to write the way I want to. But those are few and far between. That‚Äôs what this challenge has been for me
column4: is pushing myself to do something through the veil that autism drapes over my focus. I could only write on ‚Äògood‚Äô days. But at the same time
column5: I want to put myself out there as I actually am. It can be frustrating reading through other people‚Äôs work and it‚Äôs all well worded and clear. I want to show that this is most days. Coping
column7: struggling ‚Äòto word‚Äô. Squeezing out a few words every minute
column10: and re-reading. Staring at everything for several minutes
column11: trying to find the next word. It‚Äôs taken me an hour to get this far.This is me
column12: writing with Autism. This is most days. Some days are better
column13: some days are worse. If I can‚Äôt write like the other bloggers most of the time
column14: that‚Äôs fine. If I can‚Äôt put out content of that caliber as often
column15: that‚Äôs fine. I will do what I can when I can and put out the best effort I‚Äôve got.I am Autism. And I‚Äôm fine with that." True text

column1: neurodelightful 160129542211 "2017-04-29 21:22:58 GMT" https://neurodelightful.tumblr.com/post/160129542211/redinstead-april-challenge-day-29-collections "I‚Äôve always had a habit of collecting things. First it was marbles
column2: then later beanie babies
column3: and then Pokemon cards. Then after high school I got into collecting anime figures
column4: mostly figma and Nendoroids (anything with poseable/swappable parts really). When I still lived with my parents
column5: I started running out of space for figures. After moving out I have even less space
column6: so most of my collection has been packed away. I am currently working on ‚Äòcurating‚Äô my collection and downsizing by selling off the ones that don‚Äôt make the cut on ebay. I haven‚Äôt actually gotten a figure in about a year because I just don‚Äôt have the money or the space. I would like for my collection to focus on Legend of Zelda and Saber from Fate/Stay Night. As far as Sabers go I have most of them
column7: but I‚Äôve gotten a little behind on the Zelda figures (I only have figma Skyward Sword Link and Nendoroid Wind Waker Link).I also really like to collect information. I like researching natural/healthy living

column1: neurodelightful 160048404737 "2017-04-27 13:30:25 GMT" https://neurodelightful.tumblr.com/post/160048404737/redinstead-april-challenge-day-28-phone "I hate the phone. SO. MUCH. And yet there‚Äôs so many phone calls I need to make because I‚Äôm an adult and no one will do it for me
column2: or in many cases legally can. Doctor‚Äôs appointments
column3: tech support
column4: Social Security
column5: bank errors‚Ä¶ all stressful calls!And NO ONE (except my husband) seems to understand why it‚Äôs a thing I can‚Äôt ‚Äújust do‚Äù. And they are quite quick to throw the fact that I‚Äôm an adult into my face any chance they can about it.Scripting helps for the introductory sentence
column6: but beyond that everything always seems to go off script immediately and I get flustered. " True text

column1: neurodelightful 160040872091 "2017-04-27 06:16:13 GMT" https://neurodelightful.tumblr.com/post/160040872091/redinstead-april-challenge-day-27-nonverbal "I‚Äôm not nonverbal most of the time
column2: but I definitely go non-verbal sometimes. In middle school I hit a major autistic burnout and was semi-verbal for about 3 years. Sensory overloads
column3: meltdowns
column4: and strong emotional responses can all cause me to go semi- to non-verbal. This was actually very frustrating at the start of me and my husband‚Äôs relationship
column5: as I knew almost nothing about autism then and neither of us understood what was going on. He was amazingly patient with me though
column6: which I still greatly appreciate to this day. " True text

column1: neurodelightful 160040641516 "2017-04-27 06:05:26 GMT" https://neurodelightful.tumblr.com/post/160040641516/redinstead-april-challenge-day-26-labels "Lost function in my ring and pinky finger for most of the day
column2: so that was fun. Anyways
column3: now that I can type
column4: on to day 26 (and then 27 since I‚Äôm behind yet again)!I don‚Äôt have too much to say on this one other than I prefer identity-first language because it‚Äôs easier and less clunky feeling. I like identifying as autistic
column6: spoonie. They give me a sense of understanding of why I am who I am
column7: and keeping the label close at heart helps remind me so I keep it in my perspective." True text

column1: neurodelightful 159957368291 "2017-04-25 00:24:53 GMT" https://neurodelightful.tumblr.com/post/159957368291/redinstead-april-challenge-day-24-better-with "I wanted to use this freebie to do a positive post (credit and thanks for the topic idea go to my husband!). So today‚Äôs topic will be about things about autism that make my life better
column2: or things I enjoy or appreciate more because I‚Äôm autistic. I‚Äôve talked before about how my ability to hyperfocus can be incredibly useful
column3: and I actually really enjoy using this ‚Äòskill‚Äô. My hyperfocus allows me to accomplish things that would otherwise go undone as no one else really has any patience. I also feel like I get more enjoyment out of tv shows and video games. Minecraft
column4: for example
column5: I could play almost endlessly. It‚Äôs a perfect blend that just matches me perfectly. When I don‚Äôt have the spoons to do one task in game
column6: I can work on something else. I can build a giant castle when I feel creative
column7: or just farm and build up resources to trade with villagers. I‚Äôm always getting some sense of productivity out of the game. I can also listen to the same song for a month straight
column8: so I don‚Äôt have to find new music constantly!This post didn‚Äôt end up as good as I hoped because it‚Äôs been a rather overloading day
column9: I may revisit it in the future. " True text

column1: neurodelightful 159898636553 "2017-04-23 13:30:43 GMT" https://neurodelightful.tumblr.com/post/159898636553/redinstead-april-challenge-day-23-friendship "I‚Äôve always had difficulty with friendship. I want friends
column2: and enjoy having them
column3: but it takes a lot of energy and I‚Äôm very picky about who I choose to be my friends. I‚Äôm always anxious in social situations
column4: partially because of past experiences and partially because of a lack of grasp of social conventions. I really want a sense of community
column5: which is part of why I started my shop and this blog. I figure if anyone is going to be understanding of my social quirks
column6: it will be my fellow neurodivergent people. It can be really difficult for me to keep a conversation going
column7: especially when words just start failing. " True text

column1: neurodelightful 159880244401 "2017-04-23 00:15:04 GMT" https://neurodelightful.tumblr.com/post/159880244401/redinstead-april-challenge-day-22-school "It sucked. :DI was highly bullied
column2: but being ‚Äòshy and quiet‚Äô I never really spoke up about it. And when I did
column3: I wasn‚Äôt firm enough I guess so my concerns were just brushed aside. I was a mostly good student until around 5-6th grade
column4: with 95-100% grades. Then multiplication tables hit
column5: and I hit a wall. I just couldn‚Äôt get a handle on them
column6: and instead of stopping to actually help me through it
column7: I was brushed to the side again and class just kept passing me by
column8: with me getting further and further behind. This should have been a sign to someone that some sort of intervention was needed
column9: but no one seemed to care to do anything but blame it on me. And instead of being held back
column10: ‚ÄúNo Child Left Behind‚Äù kept forcing me through grades so I coasted up to 12th grade with F-filled report cards and essentially a 5th grade education. Not only that
column11: but we had moved during my high school years and most of what passing classes I did have weren‚Äôt even at the new school so I lost all of the credits. This overall meant that not only would I need to pass my current classes to graduate
column12: but I needed roughly 2 more years worth of credits. Between that and the bullying becoming worse again
column13: I begged my dad to let me drop out.I definitely believe now that my autism is why I had so much problem in school both socially and academically. I honestly think ‚ÄúNo Child Left Behind‚Äù needs to be done away with
column14: as it doesn‚Äôt really help anyone. If a student is struggling in school
column15: a ‚Äòfree pass‚Äô isn‚Äôt the answer (and trust me when I say that that‚Äôs what a lot of the failing students see it as). If a student is failing
column16: the reasons WHY should be investigated
column17: instead of trying to bribe/guilt them into ‚Äúgetting over it‚Äù. " True text

column1: neurodelightful 159825522514 "2017-04-21 13:30:38 GMT" https://neurodelightful.tumblr.com/post/159825522514/redinstead-april-challenge-day-21-support "It‚Äôs kinda obvious by now if you‚Äôve read my previous posts
column2: but my husband is my single best support system. Being autistic himself
column3: he understands me better than anyone else ever has (and it works the other way around too). We‚Äôre both sort of still learning how to deal with all this autism stuff
column4: but having our combined efforts towards it makes it go a lot smoother I think! He helps keep me calm when I‚Äôm overloaded
column5: and ‚Äòtroubleshoots‚Äô me when I go into a meltdown and am to stubborn to realize what I need to do to help myself. " True text

column1: neurodelightful 159806070886 "2017-04-20 23:24:04 GMT" https://neurodelightful.tumblr.com/post/159806070886/redinstead-april-challenge-day-20-crowds "It‚Äôs very rare that I enjoy crowded areas. If I ever feel like I‚Äôm in someone‚Äôs way
column2: that‚Äôs one of the fastest ways to send me into a breakdown. Which mostly happens while shopping at places like Wal-Mart
column3: with how crowded the aisles can get and people constantly having a ‚Äògoal‚Äô of where they want to go.When I met my husband
column4: our first date was at an anime convention. I actually really enjoyed the crowds there for the most part. It was all just positive energy with no one ‚Äòneeding‚Äô to go anywhere. And if you had to take a moment to get out of the crowds for a bit and breathe
column5: people there understand. I‚Äôm looking forward to going to another one soon!" True text

column1: neurodelightful 159805814486 "2017-04-20 23:15:19 GMT" https://neurodelightful.tumblr.com/post/159805814486/redinstead-april-challenge-day-19-autism "Late again
column2: please forgive me!I actually really love the infinity symbol in rainbow! That‚Äôs why I was more than happy to make a version of it for my shop‚Äôs logo. I also added in a little mandala flourish. I really enjoy drawing mandalas
column3: and I think it‚Äôs a great addition in my logo
column4: as I want to promote love
column6: and acceptance of autism and other neurodivergencies. I don‚Äôt care at all for the puzzle piece symbol
column7: for the obvious reasons.I also agree that the spoon theory fits well with autism! I‚Äôd be a spoonie regardless since I‚Äôm otherwise disabled
column8: but my autism is one of the biggest factors in my spoon amount. It‚Äôs a quick way to convey to those around me how I‚Äôm feeling
column9: and somewhat covert so that random nosy strangers aren‚Äôt involved. " True text

column1: neurodelightful 159715519207 "2017-04-18 13:30:28 GMT" https://neurodelightful.tumblr.com/post/159715519207/redinstead-april-challenge-day-18-sensory "One of the absolute worst things is too many sounds going on at once. Which‚Ä¶ happens a lot in this house. It was really bad back in school too
column2: which I‚Äôm realizing was a lot of my problem with it. What‚Äôs worse is no one except my husband seems to understand it? It‚Äôs actually hard to type because it‚Äôs going on right now. We have a tv out in the living room with surround sound blasting
column3: while mom tries to cook and yells across the house over the tv to dad who is hard of hearing and yells back‚Ä¶ and then every dog in the neighborhood barks constantly while the children in the street scream at each other. And then mom pops in occasionally to ask random questions that I don‚Äôt know the answer to because I can‚Äôt really think? She wants to set up a doctor‚Äôs appointment for me but I‚Äôm not really sure if I‚Äôm comfortable with it or not because I can‚Äôt even think?I‚Äôve been picking the skin on my lips constantly until they bleed because it‚Äôs my default stress/overload coping thing. Stim toys help with regulating
column4: but most don‚Äôt do too much to help with overload. The best thing I can do for overload is to get away from the situation or make it stop
column5: but that is rarely if ever an option. My Klixx probably helped the most
column7: and the clicking would probably get on everyone‚Äôs nerves. Headphones don‚Äôt do much unless everyone actually leaves me alone
column8: which is pretty rare. My husband often tries to help me when I start having sensory overload
column9: but sometimes I‚Äôm already sort of in a meltdown and don‚Äôt really let him help. :(" True text

column1: neurodelightful 159707508886 "2017-04-18 06:20:30 GMT" https://neurodelightful.tumblr.com/post/159707508886/attention-international-fidgeters "neurodelightful: For those that would like an affordable
column2: quality metal fidget spinner with FREE international shipping
column3: check out the iSpin on Indiegogo:  [Image description: A brass fidget spinner is shown in varying configurations on a black
column4: reflective table with a black background. The round brass bearing in the center of the spinner is shown with up to six cylindrical arms.¬† Each arm has three o-ring bands in red
column6: and blue. On the far left of the image
column7: the spinner is shown balanced with only one arm attached. To the right of it
column8: another copy of the spinner is shown with two arms on opposite sides. In the middle
column9: the spinner with all six arms arranged like a boat wheel. To the right of that one
column10: the spinner shown with four arms in an ‚Äòx‚Äô pattern. To the far right
column11: the spinner with three arms attached in a ‚Äòy‚Äô pattern.] You can order one for as low as $15 during the Indiegogo campaign
column12: and they will retail later for $24. But the important part is FREE SHIPPING WORLDWIDE. That means countries like Australia with it‚Äôs ridiculous shipping prices? You all have such limited access to things as it is
column13: this is possibly an amazing opportunity. I wanted to be sure you all were aware of this
column14: as it‚Äôs pretty much the price of JUST shipping anything to Australia.  Please share and spread this around so that anyone who wants to can take advantage of this! Also
column15: as it is now they will come with an extra bearing
column16: so you might be able to DIY an extra spinner! If they hit $200k raised
column17: they will be including a high-quality plastic tri-spinner as well
column18: which usually go for $15 on their own.  Last chance to order at the $15 mark! There is less than 3 days left of the campaign. Unfortunately it doesn‚Äôt seem we‚Äôll make the stretch goal
column19: but $15 for just the brass spinner is still an amazing deal
column20: especially to international customers. After the campaign
column21: they‚Äôll raise to the full price of $24
column22: and I‚Äôm not sure how they‚Äôll handle shipping after that. They‚Äôve said that they‚Äôll be shipping out at the end of April. I‚Äôve got mine ordered
column23: so I‚Äôll make sure to post a review when it comes in." False text

column1: neurodelightful 160558510751 "2017-05-11 19:26:50 GMT" https://neurodelightful.tumblr.com/post/160558510751/outdoors-collection "safechewablethings: neurodelightful: autisticandpoor:  Say
column2: would you like some chewable silicone rings? This site now has a selection of their rings for 40% off to make way for a new season‚Äôs line. ¬†Some are as cheap as $11.99.  (Mod note:  Sale is now over.)   I want some of these!!! I‚Äôm really bad about chewing on my fingers when I‚Äôm upset stressed so this would be a good alternative. I‚Äôm not sure if they are chewable grade though
column3: perhaps @safechewablethings could weigh in?  Also keep an eye out for sales
column4: they seem to do them semi regularly Since they are made from medical grade silicone they should be safe for chewing.¬†Do note though: It is a ring. Because it is a ring there isn‚Äôt much to chew on and it is very thin.¬†It will most likely get destroyed quite fast if you do decide to chew on it
column5: but i don‚Äôt see why it wouldn‚Äôt be safe.¬†" False link

column1: neurodelightful 159402987151 "2017-04-10 04:53:16 GMT" https://neurodelightful.tumblr.com/post/159402987151/neurodiversity-2017-t-shirt "autisticadvocacy: Each brain is wired uniquely. It‚Äôs what makes you YOU. Celebrate it with ThinkGeek‚Äôs Neurodiversity Tee! Purchase during April and it supports ASAN‚Äôs work AND you get a cool tee! Available in Unisex
column2: Ladies
column3: and Kids sizes. Just ordered one for me and one for the husband
column4: can‚Äôt wait!" False link

column1: neurodelightful 159254627491 "2017-04-06 05:13:50 GMT" https://neurodelightful.tumblr.com/post/159254627491/the-autistic-self-advocacy-network "This is important and amazing! If you can‚Äôt donate directly but you/your family shops on Amazon
column2: this can help. You do have to make sure you buy while on an Amazon Smiles link. But for those with executive dysfunction and/or forgetfulness
column3: there‚Äôs a browser plugin (for Firefox at least
column4: I haven‚Äôt checked other browsers) that helps redirect you to Smiles. I‚Äôm not completely sure how it works yet
column5: but I‚Äôm sure it can help." True link

column1: neurodelightful 159254398651 "2017-04-06 05:05:10 GMT" https://neurodelightful.tumblr.com/post/159254398651/2017-april-giveaway-a-day "We will be participating in this giveaway! Stay tuned for more information~ In the mean time
column2: feel free to enter the other giveaways every day for awesome prizes from awesome people!" True link
